Maybe Mr. Martin's assistant could post a poll to see how much interest there is in this - and sell them on a pre-order basis. Just sayin ....
The Queen of Thorns, the Old Bear, the Onion Knight, and Prince Doran Martell  --  that man's gotta have one of the twistiest minds in fiction, and the Rose isn't that far behind!

Olenna Tyrell, modeled after Betty White!
or Linda Hunt
It's a testament to the consistency of your characters, George, that these votes are so evenly distributed. Even the "less popular" characters have a reasonable amount of votes.

But I want them all! :o)

They already did young Robert, so I would have voted for a Rhaegar to go with him if I could have. Hopefully his absence just means he's already in the pipeline! Dark Sword's minis are amazing!

PS. How did you like Tom Meier's 54mm Ser Loras?

I voted for Strong Belwas, Stoneheart, and the mounted Drogo.
Looking at their other miniatures, I'd think more people would want strong Belwas simply for how unique he would look next to all of the knights in their armor.

comments.subject: WoW

comments.article:
Vote Rorge and Biter!!!!!!!!!!!

Gracious Ser, could you tell me the approximate size of these miniatures? DH and I are AVID collectors. We have a humongous glass display case of Ice and Fire miniatures right above our shelf of our favorite fantasy works. They unfortunately are under lock and key... after taking a toddler to the ER due to a swallowing incident, we have learned the hard way! LOL

(he's fine and thank the seven it went down and he didn't choke on it as we were playing our MUSH at the time)

We're not going to stop having babies and we'd love to keep collecting too! So could you say these are 3 years of age and up, sizewise?????

The minis are way smaller than a 3-year old child if that is what you mean. :o)

They're 32mm scale, I'm pretty sure, which means the normal human-sized minis are around an inch tall, give or take a sixteenth or two. Big guys like the Mountain are obviously a little bigger, and small people like Arya and Tyrion are a little smaller. If they're not 32mm, they're 28mm, which is a tiny bit smaller still. Pretty sure they're 32mm though.

They also have 54mm versions of Tyrion, the first Dany mini, and an incredible new(ish) Ser Loras that Tom Meier sculpted up in secret as a surprise for Mr. Martin which I am surprised not to have seen him post about here yet since it's been in Dark Sword's online store since mid-November and was announced in their newsletter back around the same time. Those ones should be almost twice the size of the 32mm minis; a little harder to swallow, but probably not completely impossible.

So yeah, definitely a choking hazard for small children, especially the ones that require assembly, since those come with extra swords, heads, shields, limbs, or what have you, which can occasionally fall off if they're not glued on that well or get bumped around too much. Keep'em locked up or out of reach for sure as long as you have young children in your house.

Out of curiosity, what Ice & Fire minis have you got in your display case, if you don't already know how big Dark Sword's Ice & Fire minis are? Only similar products I know of are some larger busts that are way too big to choke on, plus a very few minis that were put out by Testors a few years back which can be quite hard to find.
How about an unnamed miniature of a new point of a view character from the next book?
